text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in kitchen I want to show you
how to make a 10-minute tofu stir fry it
is so good so easy I happen to
absolutely love tofu but if you're not a
big fan you can always substitute cooked
chicken or raw chicken that you'll saute
or even shrimp so it's a really easy
recipe I have already shared how to make
a chicken stir fry before so this is
very similar but I wanted to share with
you because I think it is one of the
most amazing ways to eat tofu and I love
it so the ingredients you'll need are
very few you can change the veggies of
course just full with what you have on
hand what I like to use are some
broccoli florets these are some shiitake
mushrooms that have been sliced this is
some bok choy and this is sort of the
stem of the bok choy and I have the
leafy tops over here along with some
snow peas because I want to put these at
the last minute I've got some ginger
paste and some grated garlic we chopped
garlic
Oster sauce soy sauce I always like to
use low-sodium a little bit of toasted
sesame oil and you're going to need a
little bit of water as well now of
course the star of the show is going to
be your tofu which I have on my plastic
board here the tofu you want to use for
this is usually labeled extra firm you
don't want to use softened tofu you want
to use extra firm that way it's going to
keep its shape now when you get to food
its kind of packed it's packed with some
liquid like water so you want to dry it
out that's one of the most important
things to cooking tofu of any kind is
you want to dry it out a little bit so
what I like to do is I like to take a
some paper towel line a plate with them
and then I had to take my tofu and just
cut it into I would say half inch or so
slices just like that
and then put them on your paper
towel-lined plate and then what you do
is you take some more paper towels and
also use a kitchen towel if you want to
if you don't want to use paper towels I
do tend to think that the paper towel
helps absorb more of that water or that
liquid and just press down
them as much as you can just to again
orb as much liquid as possible because
that way you're going to nice crust and
then once I cut them into about one inch
cubes I just take whatever paper towel I
have here and I just like to sort of
toss them around and dry them off on the
cut sides because they're you know there
is a little bit of that liquid in the
center but for the most part this is
what you're looking for you're looking
for them to be pretty much nice and dry
and now what I have here is a large
skillet with some vegetable oil like
sunflower oil peanut oil anything sort
of clear and unflavored and I have that
preheating over pretty high heat I
wanted over about medium-high because
tofu is already ready to go you're just
looking to sear it you're looking to
give it some good color and you want it
to be doing a stirfry anyway you want
high high heat and ideally you use a wok
I'm still searching for the best walk
around so if you have any suggestions
please leave them below
but that's why you always want to make
sure that your heat is really really
high and in that way it won't stick
either so I'm just going to add my tofu
in and let it sear for just a couple of
minutes on all sides so we're looking
good
take that off set it aside onto a plate
and let's proceed I'm going to take my
toasted sesame oil I'm going to add a
little bit of that a little goes a long
way with the stuff so do be careful and
then I also have my garlic and ginger

for literally 30 seconds it was splatter
a little um my badges right in it will
splatter a little cuz it's of the ginger
is if it's a paste but you can also of
course just use regular fresh ginger and
just chop it up yourself oh but the
reason why I always like to keep ginger

two but keep it in my fridge and it
doesn't spoil really quickly that's why

before I have a chance to use it all so
I don't want to do that it smells so
good already as soon as that ginger

high heat
in the meantime you just take your small

Peas and the green top and you're pretty

because there is that sesame oil in

the tofu which is something that you
should keep in mind when it comes to
cooking with tofu if you aren't familiar
with it it's kind of like a blank canvas
it will soak up any flavor you introduce

soaked up that sauce so beautifully mmm
it's so good I really I absolutely try
